translation: Now beings the description regarding the sending of gopas to the houses of Brahmins

gurmukhi: kY kRIVw ien so ikSn kY jmnw ieSnwnu ] bhur sXwm bn ko gey gaU su qiRnn crwn ]299]
transliteration: Kai Kridaa In So Kishan Kai Jamnaa Ishnaan(u)|| Bahur Syaam Ban Ko Gad Gado Su Trinan Charaan||299||
translation: After voluptuous play with the gopis and taking bath Krishna went to the forest to graze the cows.299.

gurmukhi: kiRSn srwhq qrn ko bn mY Awgy gey ] sMg gÍwl jyqy huqy qy sB BUK Bey ]300]
transliteration: Krishan Saraahat Taran Ko Ban Mai Aage Gad|| San Gvaal Jete Houte Te Sabh Bhookh Bhae||300||
translation: Praising the beautiful women, Krishna went further and the gopa boys who were with him, became hungry.300.

gurmukhi: pqR Bly iqn ky suB PUl Bly Pl hY suB soB suhweI ] BUK lgy Gr ko aumgy pY ibrwjn ko suKdw prCweI ]
transliteration: Patra Bhale Tin Ke Soubh Phool Bhale Phal Hai Soubh Sobh Suhaaee|| Bhookh Lage Ghar Ko Oumge Pai Biraajan Ko Soukhdaa Parchhaade||
translation: The leaves of those trees are good, their flowers, fruit and shade are all good; at the time of coming home,

gurmukhi: kwnH qrY iqhky murlI gih kY kr mo muK swQ bjweI ] TwiF rhXo sun paun GrI iek Qkq rhI jmunw aurJweI ]301]
transliteration: Kaahn Darai Tihke Murligadh Kai Kar Mo Moukh Saath Bajaaee|| Thaadh(i) Rahyo Soun Paoun Ghariik Thakat Rahi Ja Mounnda Urjhaaee||301||
translation: Krishna played on his flute under those trees; hearing the voice of his flute, the wind seemed to stop blowing for a while and Yamuna also got entangled.301.

gurmukhi: mwlisrI Aru jYqisrI suB swrMg bwjq hY Aru gaurI ] soriT su`D mlwr iblwvl mITI hY AMmiRq qy nh kaurI ]
transliteration: Maalsiriar(u) Jaitsirisoubh Saaran Baajat Hai Ar(u) Gadddee|| Sorath(i) Suddh Malaar Bilaaval Meethihai Anmrit Te Nah Kauree||
translation: Krishna plays on his flute the musical modes like Malshri, Jaitshri, Sarang, Gauri, Sorath, Shuddh Malhar and the Bilawal which is sweet like nectar;

gurmukhi: kwnH bjwvq hY murlI sun hoq surI AsurI sB baurI ] Awie geI biRKBwn suqw sun pY qrnI hrnI ijmu daurI ]302]
transliteration: Kaahn Bajaavat Hai Murlisoun Hot Suriasurisabh Bauree|| Ooe Gadbrikhbhaan Soutaa Soun Pai Tarnidarnijim(u) Dauree||302||
translation: Hearing these Ragas, the heavenly damsels and the wives of demons all are getting fascinated; hearing the voice of the flute, Radha, the daughter of Brishbhan is coming running like a doe.302.

gurmukhi: jor pRnwm krXo hir ko kir nwQ suno hm BUK lgI hY ] dUr rhy sB gopn ky Gr Kyln kI sB su`D BgI hY ]
transliteration: Jor Pranaam Daryo Har(i) Ko Kar(i) Naath Souno Ham Bhookh Lagihai|| Door Rahe Sabh Gopan Ke Ghar Khelan Kisabh Suddh Bhagihai||
translation: Radha said with folded hands, “O Lord ! I am hungry; the milk has remained back in all the houses of the gopas and while playing, I forgot everything;

gurmukhi: folq sMg lgY qumry hm kwnH qbY sun bwq pgI hY ] jwhu khXo mQurw giH ib`pn siq khXo nih bwq TgI hY ]303]
transliteration: Dolat San Toumre Ham Kaahn Tabai Soun Baat Pagihai|| Jaahu Kahyo Mathuraa Girh Bippnan Sat(i) Kahyo Nah(i) Baat Thagihai||303||
translation: “I am wandering alongwith you;” when Krishna heard this, the told all to go into the houses of Brahmins in Mathura (and bring something to eat); I am speaking truth to you, there is not an iota of falsehood in it.”303.
